datadraw

Class CameraControl

  • java.lang.Object
    • datadraw.CameraControl

  • public class CameraControl
extends Object
    Simple 2D camera functionality for panning and zooming around a scene. Plays nice with datadraw.editor.Editor. Ideal for quickly setting up a 2D visualization that you can 'explore'.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CameraControl(PApplet parent, MouseControl mcontrol)
      Call this in 'setup'.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void ApplyPanTranslation()
      Do a translation (using Processing's translate) to put panning into affect.
      void ApplyZoomScale()
      Do a scale (using Processing's scale) to put zooming into affect.
      void DisablePanning()
      Prevent left mouse button drag from controlling panning.
      void DisableZooming()
      Prevent the mouse wheel (or other scrolling input) from controling zooming.
      void EnablePanning()
      Allow left mouse button drag to control panning.
      void EnableZoom()
      Allow the mouse wheel (or other scrolling input) to control zooming.
      PVector GetPan()
      Get a vector describing the current mouse pan.
      float GetZoom()
      Get a float describing the zoom scale.
      boolean IsPanning()
      Is the mouse currently panning (left mouse button being dragged).
      void pre() 
      void SetZoomPower(float power)
      Set how quickly you can zoom in or out.
      PVector ToScreenSpace(PVector p)
      Transforms a point from world coordinates (modifed by panning and zooming) to screen coordinates (in pixels).
      PVector ToWorldSpace(PVector p)
      Transforms a point from screen coordinates (in pixels) to coordinates modified by the panning and zooming CameraControl enables.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        public PVector ToWorldSpace(PVector p)
        Transforms a point from screen coordinates (in pixels) to coordinates modified by the panning and zooming CameraControl enables.

      • ToScreenSpace

        public PVector ToScreenSpace(PVector p)
        Transforms a point from world coordinates (modifed by panning and zooming) to screen coordinates (in pixels).
        Returns:
        PVector

      • ApplyPanTranslation

        public void ApplyPanTranslation()
        Do a translation (using Processing's translate) to put panning into affect.

      • ApplyZoomScale

        public void ApplyZoomScale()
        Do a scale (using Processing's scale) to put zooming into affect.

      • GetPan

        public PVector GetPan()
        Get a vector describing the current mouse pan.
        Returns:
        pVector

      • GetZoom

        public float GetZoom()
        Get a float describing the zoom scale.
        Returns:
        pVector

      • IsPanning

        public boolean IsPanning()
        Is the mouse currently panning (left mouse button being dragged).
        Returns:
        boolean

      • EnablePanning

        public void EnablePanning()
        Allow left mouse button drag to control panning. Note that ApplyPanTranslation must be called before drawing objects you want to be affected by panning.

      • DisablePanning

        public void DisablePanning()
        Prevent left mouse button drag from controlling panning.

      • EnableZoom

        public void EnableZoom()
        Allow the mouse wheel (or other scrolling input) to control zooming. Note that ApplyZoomScale must be called before drawing objects you want to be affected by zooming.

      • DisableZooming

        public void DisableZooming()
        Prevent the mouse wheel (or other scrolling input) from controling zooming. Note that ApplyZoomScale must be called before drawing objects you want to be affected by zooming.

      • SetZoomPower

        public void SetZoomPower(float power)
        Set how quickly you can zoom in or out.

      • pre

        public void pre()
